articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Kumsusan Palace of Sun
						
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, with Ri Sol Ju visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun to pay deep respects to leader Kim Jong Il on Saturday, his birth anniversary. 
					 Kim Jong Un entered the hall where statues of great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il are standing.
					
					 The chief of the guard of honor of the army, navy and air and anti-air force of the KPA and the Worker-Peasant Red Guards made a salute to the Generalissimos. 
					
					 A floral basket in the name of Kim Jong Un was placed before the statues.
					
					 He, together with the participants, paid tribute to the statues. 
					
					 Then he entered the hall of immortality where Kim Jong Il lies in state. 
					
					 He, together with the participants, made bows to Kim Jong Il in the humblest reverence.
					
					 Then he went round the hall where the orders Kim Jong Il received are on display and the halls which house a car, electric car, boat and train coach used by him. 
					
					 He was accompanied by Choe Ryong Hae, Jang Song Thaek, Hyon Yong Chol, Kim Kyok Sik, Kim Kyong Hui, Pak To Chun, Kim Yong Chun, Hyon Chol Hae, Kim Won Hong, Kim Jong Gak, Ju Kyu Chang, Kim Kyong Ok, Yun Jong Rin, Choe Pu Il, Ri Yong Gil, Son Chol Ju, Ryom Chol Song, Jo Kyong Chol, Yun Tong Hyon, Kang Phyo Yong, Ri Pyong Chol, Kim Rak Gyom, Pak Jong Chon, Kim Chun Sam, Kim Yong Chol, Jon Chang Bok and other members of the Party Central Military Commission and the National Defence Commission, staff members of the KPA Supreme Command and KPA commanding officers.

articles.title: Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il Erected at Mangyongdae Revolutionary School
articles.content:
Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il Erected at Mangyongdae Revolutionary School
						
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- Statues of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il were erected at Mangyongdae Revolutionary School on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star).
					 An unveiling ceremony was held with splendor on Saturday.
					
					 The dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un was present at the ceremony.
					
					 Also present there were Choe Yong Rim, Choe Ryong Hae, Jang Song Thaek, Hyon Yong Chol, Kim Kyok Sik, Kim Kyong Hui, Kim Ki Nam, Kim Yong Chun, Ri Yong Mu, O Kuk Ryol, Hyon Chol Hae, Kim Jong Gak, and officials of the party and armed forces organs, staff members and students of the school and its graduates, officials of units and military academies at all levels, service personnel of the KPA, military family members and officials and employees of the units who contributed to the erection of the statues and Pyongyangites.
					
					 Choe Yong Rim, Choe Ryong Hae, Jang Song Thaek and others unveiled the statues.
					
					 Laid before them was a floral basket bearing the august name of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Laid there then were a floral basket in the joint name of the Central Committee and the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea and the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and a floral basket in the name of the school.
					
					 Floral baskets were also placed in the name of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, the General Staff of the KPA, the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces and units and sub-units of the KPA at all levels and military academies.
					
					 All the participants paid tribute to the Generalissimos in humblest reverence.
					
					 KPA Vice Marshal Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the WPK and director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, made a speech there. 
					
					 He went on:
					
					 Kim Jong Il deemed it as an important work for giving steady continuity to the bloodline of revolution to educate the children of revolutionary martyrs from the first day of his revolutionary leadership and paid deep attention to the work of the school in the grim days of leading to victory the confrontation with the U.S. and the struggle for defending socialism under the uplifted banner of Songun.
					
					 It was the unanimous desire of all teachers and pupils of the school and service personnel of the KPA to erect the statue of Kim Jong Il at the school where people erected Kim Il Sung's statue for the first time in Korea at the initiative of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk who took into consideration the ardent desire of the schoolers to see Kim Il Sung every day.
					
					 The ardent desire of the teachers and pupils and all service personnel has become a brilliant reality thanks to the intense loyalty and meticulous guidance of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Rosy is the future of the children of revolutionary martyrs, the speaker said, calling for waging a dynamic struggle to reunify the country and accomplish the Juche-based revolutionary cause of Songun under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, the banner of eternal victory of the great Paektusan nation, as befitting the descendants of Generalissimo Kim Il Sung and the soldiers and disciples of Generalissimo Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Jong Un warmly acknowledged the cheers of all the participants.

articles.title: Tribute Paid to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Tribute Paid to Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- Senior party and state officials including Kim Yong Nam and Choe Yong Rim, the chairperson of a friendly party and officials of the party, armed forces and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Saturday, the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) and paid tribute to him.
					 Seen before their statues was a floral basket with a ribbon bearing the august name of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also placed before them was a floral basket in the joint name of the Central Committee and the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK and the DPRK Cabinet.
					
					 The participants paid high tribute to the statues.
					
					 At the halls of immortality where Kim Jong Il lies in state, they made bows to him in humblest reverence.
					
					 They went round the hall where orders Kim Jong Il received are on display and halls which house car, electric car, boat and train coach used by him.

articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Un from Chongryon Central Standing Committee
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Un from Chongryon Central Standing Committee
						
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a letter from the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) Saturday, the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The letter said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il successfully accomplished the cause of immortalizing President Kim Il Sung for the first time in history, giving steady continuity to his immortal revolutionary history in the homeland.
					
					 Kim Jong Il made long journeys of Songun unprecedented in the world history, frustrating the imperialist forces' moves to isolate and stifle the DPRK, turning the homeland into a political and ideological power which achieved single-minded unity, a tremendous military power, a full-fledged nuclear weapons state, satellite manufacturer and launcher and providing an eternal cornerstone for building a thriving nation.
					
					 He was an outstanding leader who wisely steered Chongryon and the movement of Koreans in Japan with far-sighted wisdom and a tender-hearted father of the compatriots in Japan.
					
					 The patriotic movement of Chongryon is now steadily advancing along the road of new development under your wise leadership, the letter noted, and continued:
					
					 Chongryon will hold Generalissimo Kim Jong Il in high esteem for all ages as the eternal sun as taught by you in your New Year message and steadily develop Chongryon, which was formed and emerged victorious under the care of the great men of Mt. Paektu, into a model organization of the world overseas compatriots movement.
					
					 It said that Chongryon would perform proud feats in the drive for ushering in a new period of surge in the movement of Koreans in Japan with the dignity and stamina of Kim Il Sung's nation and Kim Jong Il's Korea and the might of single-minded unity and thus live up to the deep love and trust of Kim Jong Un with spectacular successes in its work.

articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Un from C.C., AINDF
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Un from C.C., AINDF
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un received a letter from the Central Committee of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front (AINDF) on Feb. 16, the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 For our fellow countrymen, February 16 when the bright star of Mt. Paektu rose is the day of a great jubilee as it firmly promised a bright future of Kim Il Sung's nation that will be blessed with illustrious leaders generation after generation, the letter said.
					
					 Kim Jong Il, who was born in Mt. Paektu, the holy mountain of revolution, and grew up, nurturing the patriotic soul, steered the country and the nation, the era and history with his extraordinary wisdom, outstanding leadership ability and bold actions in the grimmest yet glorious years and performed undying feats, it noted.
					
					 The letter said that his lifelong patriotic cause is being successfully carried forward by Marshal Kim Jong Un, who fully inherited the bloodline of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 The successful 3rd underground nuclear test conducted by the DPRK to cope with the U.S. hostile actions is the brilliant fruition of the extraordinary stratagem, resolute pluck and distinguished leadership ability of you who are firmly defending the dignity and sovereignty of the country and nation despite any storm and stress, it said, and went on:
					
					 The revolutionary cause of Juche and the cause of building a reunified thriving country are sure to triumph thanks to you who enjoy absolute respect and praise from all people for having brought about epochal changes and miracles with your invincible political caliber and outstanding leadership ability.
					
					 All the vanguard fighters of the AINDF will join the patriotic people from all walks of life in raising strong voices in support and solidarity for the Songun cause in the north and turn out as one in the sacred war for justice to resolutely check and frustrate the moves of the U.S. and its allies to escalate confrontation with the DPRK and thus bring a peaceful, prosperous and reunified country without fail.

articles.title: Floral Baskets Laid before Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Baskets Laid before Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- Floral baskets were laid before the statues of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star).
					 Officials of the party, armed forces and power organs, public organizations, ministries and national institutions, service personnel of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, officials in the fields of science, education, literature and arts, public health and media, bereaved families of revolutionary martyrs and other people and school youth and children visited the statues of the Generalissimos on Mansu Hill before paying tribute to them.
					
					 Seen before the statues was a floral basket sent by the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Laid before the statues were floral baskets in the name of the party, armed forces and power organs, public organizations, ministries, national institutions, units of the KPA and the KPISF, and institutions and industrial establishments, farms and schools in the city, and flowers.
					
					 Also laid before them was a floral basket in the name of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front.
					
					 People made bows to the statues in humble reverence.
					
					 Placed before the statues and portraits of the smiling Generalissimos at Kim Il Sung Military University, Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, Mansudae Art Studio and other places in Pyongyang were floral baskets in the name of KPA units, institutions and enterprises and flowers.
					
					 Service personnel, people and school youth and children visited the statues and portraits of the smiling Generalissimos in Kanggye, Hamhung cities and other provincial seats and paid high tribute to them. 
					
					 Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Honcai and staff members of his embassy laid a floral basket before the statues of the Generalissimos on Mansu Hill Saturday on this occasion.

articles.title: Foreign Guests, Overseas Koreans Pay Tribute to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreign Guests, Overseas Koreans Pay Tribute to Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- Diplomatic envoys of different countries, representatives of international organizations and the military attaches corps here, the delegation of Koreans in Japan headed by Pae Jin Gu, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, for celebrating the Day of the Shining Star, a delegation of the General Association of Koreans in China headed by its Vice-Chairman Choe Su Bong, and other foreign guests and overseas Koreans visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Saturday, the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) and paid tribute to him.
					 They paid high respects for the statues of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They entered the hall of immortality where Kim Jong Il lies in state and made a bow to him.
					
					 They went round the hall where orders he received are on display and the halls which house a car, electric car, boat and train coach used by him.
					
					 Foreign guests and overseas Koreans made entries in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Banquet Given to Mark Birth Anniversary of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Banquet Given to Mark Birth Anniversary of Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- A banquet was given at Okryu Restaurant on Saturday, the 71st birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Present there were senior party and state officials, including Kim Yong Nam and Choe Yong Rim, chairpersons of friendly parties, officials of party, armed forces and power organs, the Cabinet, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, service personnel of the Korean people's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, officials in the fields of science, education, literature and arts, public health and media and meritorious persons.
					
					 Attending it were delegations of overseas Koreans including a delegation of Koreans in Japan, overseas compatriots and the chief of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front.
					
					 Present there on invitation were diplomatic envoys of different countries, representatives of international organizations, members of the military attaches corps here and their wives and foreign guests.
					
					 A speech was made by Kim Ki Nam, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 The speaker referred to the fact that Generalissimo Kim Jong Il led the Korean revolution and the human cause of independence for a long period, performing immortal exploits on behalf of the country and its people, the times and the history.
					
					 He called upon everybody to advance straight along the road of independence, Songun and socialism to the last under the uplifted banner of immortal Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, while holding Kim Jong Il in high esteem as the eternal leader of the WPK and revolution.
					
					 He called for bringing about a decisive turn in the efforts to increase the militant might of the WPK in every way and achieve a final victory in the drive for the building of a thriving nation, in hearty response to the New YearAddress made by Kim Jong Un and his important speech at the 4th Conference of Cell Secretaries of the WPK.

articles.title: Reception Given for Overseas Koreans
articles.content:
Reception Given for Overseas Koreans
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- A reception was given for overseas Koreans on Saturday, the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Present there on invitation were overseas Koreans staying in the homeland.
					
					 Present there were Kim Jin Guk, director of the Bureau of Service for Overseas Compatriots, and officials concerned.

articles.title: Music and Dance Performance Given by Mansudae Art Troupe
articles.content:
Music and Dance Performance Given by Mansudae Art Troupe
						
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- Music and dance performance "Love the Country" was given by the artistes of the Mansudae Art Troupe at the East Pyongyang Grand Theatre on Saturday, the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star).
					 Among the audience were Choe Yong Rim and other senior officials of the party and state, the chairperson of a friendly party, officials of the party, armed forces and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, service personnel of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, meritorious persons and Pyongyangites.
					
					 Also among the audience were members of the delegation of Koreans in Japan, overseas Koreans and the chief of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front.
					
					 Present there on invitation were diplomatic envoys of different countries and representatives of international organizations here and military attaches in foreign embassies here and their wives and other foreign guests.
					
					 The performance began with prelude "We Will Go on along the Road of Loyalty". Put on the stage were chorus "Attraction and Reverence", female instrumental ensemble "I'll be the Flower to Herald the Spring" and other colorful numbers.
					
					 The performers showed well the firm resolution of all service personnel and people to remain true to the leadership of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un in such numbers as mixed duet and chorus "Our Leader Loved by People", chorus "The General Will Live Forever as the Sun" and chorus "We'll Travel One Road Forever".

articles.title: Concert Given by Unhasu Orchestra to Mark Day of Shining Star
articles.content:
Concert Given by Unhasu Orchestra to Mark Day of Shining Star
						
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- The Unhasu Orchestra gave a concert "Song of Eternal Sun" at the People's Theatre here on Saturday, the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star).
					 Among the audience were Kim Yong Nam and other senior officials of the party and state, officials in the fields of science and education, scientists and technicians, teachers, researchers and students.
					
					 Put on the stage were such numbers as piano recital and female solo "General Beaming with a Broad Smile", female solo and pangchang, "Where Are You, Dear General?", an immortal masterpiece, female solo "Wherever We Are in Our County and Whatever We See in Our Country", orchestra "Push back Frontiers of the Latest Science and Technology" and male solo "The Country Tells Me".
					
					 The artistes sang high praises of the revolutionary career and feats of the great Generalissimo Kim Jong Il who decorated the long course of the Juche revolution with victories and glory after being born as the shining star over Mt. Paektu, and demonstrated the dignity and power of Kim Il Sung's Korea at the highest level.

articles.title: Korean Children's Union Members Meet to Mark Birth Anniversary of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Korean Children's Union Members Meet to Mark Birth Anniversary of Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- There took place at the Taekwon-Do Hall Saturday a national meeting of the Korean Children's Union organizations as part of the celebrations of the 71st birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Attending it were delegates from each province of the country, schoolchildren here and the children who are admitted to the KCU.
					
					 Present there on invitation were Choe Thae Bok, Yang Hyong Sop, and other officials concerned, and officials of the party organs and the youth league here, war veterans and meritorious persons.
					
					 Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the C.C., the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, said in a report that thanks to the historic day when Generalissimo Kim Jong Il was born as a shining star over Mt. Paektu, the Korean people and school youth and children have advanced the revolutionary cause of Juche along the road of victory and glory, being blessed with the illustrious leaders generation after generation.
					
					 He called on all KCU members to reliably carry forward the revolutionary cause of Juche, the revolutionary cause of Songun by earnestly learning from the childhood of Kim Jong Il, studying hard, proving themselves to be good in organizational life and briskly conducting socio-political activities and the movement for doing good things.
					
					 There took place an admission ceremony of the KCU.
					
					 Led by Mun Kyong Dok, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, and chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK, the newcomers took oath.
					
					 Officials, war veterans and meritorious persons tied red neckerchiefs around the necks of those newcomers and pinned KCU's badges on their chests.
					
					 The newcomers made the first greetings of the KCU members, responding to the slogan "Always Be Ready for Socialist Country!"
					
					 War veteran Pak Chan Su, DPRK hero, Pang Sung Son, principal of Pyongyang Secondary School No. 1, and labor hero and people's sportswoman An Kum Ae, player of the April 25 Sports Team, made congratulatory speeches.
					
					 They urged all of them to become genuine members of the KCU glorifying Kim Il Sung's and Kim Jong Il's Korea by studying hard, bearing in mind the teaching of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un that the future appearance of prospering Korea is reflected by their records, first of all.

articles.title: Dancing Parties of Youth, Students Held
articles.content:
Dancing Parties of Youth, Students Held
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- Dancing parties of youth and students were held across the country on Saturday, the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The dancing parties held in the plazas of the Party Founding Memorial Tower, April 25 House of Culture and Arch of Triumph and other places of Pyongyang began with songs "We Will Hold Our General in High Esteem" and "Our General Is the Best".
					
					  Youth and students danced with boundless reverence for Generalissimo Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Songs including "Let Youth Advance Following the Party", "At a Go" and "Push Back the Frontiers of Latest Science and Technology" made the dancing parties more pleasant.
					
					 Profound reverence and thanks to the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un who has created a new history of the prosperous DPRK with his noble love for posterity and future could be read on the faces of the participants dancing to the tune of songs "Glory to Our Great Party" and "Our Leader Loved by People." 
					
					 Dancing parties took place in different provincial seats, cities and counties on the same day.

articles.title: Synchronized Swimming Held on Day of Shining Star
articles.content:
Synchronized Swimming Held on Day of Shining Star
						
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- A demonstration performance of synchronized swimming is going on at the Changgwang Health Complex in Pyongyang to mark the Day of the Shining Star (Feb. 16), the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The performance shows all people's ardent yearning and reverence for Kim Jong Il, who had made significant contributions to the revolutionary cause of Juche and the cause of global independence.
					
					 It also represents the fixed will of the Korean army and people to build a thriving socialist nation based on the Juche idea with the same spirit as was displayed in successfully launching the satellite Kwangmyongsong 3-2 under the guidance of their supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The performance, consisting of group, single, duet and trio synchronized swimming and others, draws high acclamation for its skillful techniques.
					
					 What catches the eyes is the group synchronized swimming "Where Are You from" performed by more than 30 schoolgirls, which gives a glimpse of the DPRK children enjoying a happy life under the care of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The demonstration performance is to run until Feb. 17.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star Celebrated in DPRK
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star Celebrated in DPRK
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's birth anniversary (the Day of the Shining Star) was significantly celebrated in the DPRK.
					 Service personnel, people of all social standings, school youth and children visited the statues of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and portraits of the smiling Generalissimos and vowed to remain true to the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, holding Kim Jong Il as the eternal leader of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people.
					
					 An endless stream of people visited the venue of the 17th Kimjongilia Festival and venues of Kimjongilia shows held here and in provinces.
					
					 People of all social standings visited the venues of the photo exhibitions and fine art exhibitions and went round historic photos and fine art pieces showing the revolutionary career and feats of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Officials, people, school youth and children across the country held meetings and concerts for remembering him.
					
					 Art performances and concerts were given at theatres, halls and squares, institutions, industrial establishments and cooperative farms in Pyongyang and local areas.
					
					 Many schoolchildren joined the Korean Children's Union, firmly pledging to grow to be reserves of Songun Korea by faithfully inheriting the bloodline of Mt. Paektu under the care of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Commercial and catering networks across the country rendered holiday services.

articles.title: Ardent Yearning for Kim Jong Il Runs Higher in DPRK
articles.content:
Ardent Yearning for Kim Jong Il Runs Higher in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- The ardent yearning for leader Kim Jong Il is running higher among the Korean people on the occasion of the Day of the Shinning Star (Feb.16), his birth anniversary.
					 An endless stream of visitors carrying bouquets and flowers flows to statues of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and mosaics picturing their smiling images across the country.
					
					 Establishments and individuals presented potted Kimjongilias in full bloom for flower exhibitions, including the 17th Kimjongilia Festival in Pyongyang.
					
					 Songs featuring ardent yearning for Kim Jong Il are heard everywhere in the country.
					
					 In his lifetime he traveled nearly 700 000 kilometer-long journey for the wellbeing of the local people. In this course he unhesitatingly got on a man car to meet miners in a deep underground pit, personally opened a family's cooking pot to see the kind of food they were taking and even named a to-be-born baby at the request of a pregnant housewife.
					
					 That is why all the people in the DPRK have always regarded him as their father and the eternal shining star.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats Praised by Chief of Pyongyang Mission of AINDF
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats Praised by Chief of Pyongyang Mission of AINDF
						
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- Jo Il Min, chief of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front (AINDF), was interviewed by KCNA on Saturday, the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star).
					 The chief expressed deep reverence for Kim Jong Il, the peerlessly great man of Mt. Paektu. He went on:
					
					 Boundless praise and reverence for Kim Jong Il prevail across the country on this morning when the dawn in February is breaking over Jong Il Peak.
					
					 The people in south Korea are praying for his immortality in humblest reverence, recollecting with deep emotion his whole life.
					
					 Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il performed undying feats on behalf of the era and history all his revolutionary life.
					
					 The most brilliant feat he performed was that he most successfully settled the issue of succession to the leadership.
					
					 The dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un is standing in the van of the Korean nation. He is identical to Kim Jong Il in idea, leadership and traits.
					
					 It is the greatest fortune and privilege of the nation to hold Kim Jong Un as the supreme leader.
					
					 Everything Kim Jong Il planned and desired is being translated into brilliant reality thanks to the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The matchless pluck and grit of Kim Jong Un is guaranteeing the dignity and sovereignty of the nation and exciting the world people.
					
					 The cause of the revolutionary cause of Juche and the cause of building a reunified thriving country will be achieved without fail thanks to Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The vanguard fighters of the AINDF and patriotic people will wage a dynamic struggle to accomplish the behests of Kim Jong Il and the noble intention of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats Will Remain Forever
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats Will Remain Forever
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- Today marks the Day of the Shining Star, the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 On Feb. 16, Juche 31 (1942), Kim Jong Il was born in Mt. Paektu as the son of guerillas. The anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters called him a bright star over Mt. Paektu, out of their wish that he would glorify Korea in the future.
					
					 In his lifetime, Kim Jong Il devoted his all to carrying forward to completion the cause of the Songun (military-first) revolution, pioneered by President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 He formulated the Juche idea, the revolutionary idea of the President, as the guiding idea in the era of independence.
					
					 Meanwhile, he turned the Workers' Party of Korea into the general staff of the revolution with the strict monolithic ideological system and the DPRK into an invincible socialist country where the leader, the party and the masses are united as one and into a world-level military power with inexhaustible strength.
					
					 That was why Kim Il Sung composed a poem "Shining Star" in praise of Kim Jong Il's great feats for the country and the times on his 50th birthday.
					
					 Since then, the word "Shining Star" has been considered a symbol of the nation's sovereignty and dignity as well as a symbol of prosperous Korea.
					
					 So, the DPRK's satellites, too, are called Kwangmyongsong in Korean word, which translates into the shining star.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats for Development of Nation's Light Industry
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats for Development of Nation's Light Industry
						
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- On the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il, the Korean people are recollecting with deep emotion the devoted service he had made in his lifetime for the development of local light industry.
					 Thanks to his energetic guidance, light industrial factories of the country were updated and are now in full operation.
					
					 The year 2011, the last year of his life, was marked by his intensive guidance tour of light industrial factories.
					
					 Among them were the Ryongaksan Spring Water Factory, foodstuff factories in Sariwon City, North Hwanghae Province and the Hamhung Woolen Mill in South Hamgyong Province.
					
					 When he visited the Hamhung Woolen Mill, he was very pleased to see the production of vinalon cloth resumed after 17 years.
					
					 Visiting the Tetron rayon fabrics workshop at the Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Textile Mill, he carefully looked into its product, calling on the mill to mass-produce various kinds of cloth favored by the people.
					
					 His guidance tour continued without letup day and night, revitalizing the light industrial bases one by one.
					
					 After all, his devoted efforts laid solid foundations for bringing about a production upsurge in the country's light industry.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Always Finds Himself among People
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Always Finds Himself among People
						
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- People in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea consider the pictures they had taken with leader Kim Jong Il to be family treasures.
					 Kim Jong Il in his lifetime ceaselessly visited military posts, factories, farms and dwelling houses throughout the country regardless of weather conditions. In the course he posed for photos with many people of different social strata.
					
					 Among them were a soldier who was standing guard on the windy Chol Pass and soldier-builders in the project for the Mujigae Tunnel.
					
					 One day Kim Jong Il came to know the fact that two soldiers on mess duty were missed in a photo session during his inspection tour of the dwarf pine post. So, he posed for a photo with them later to gratify their desire.
					
					 In early May Juche 87 (1998) when he went to a frontline military unit, he instructed general officers accompanying him to perform routine duty in place of soldiers so that he could have a photo session with all of the unit's soldiers.
					
					 It is a well-known fact that he posed for pictures with a servicewoman with a persimmon in her hand, triplet-soldiers and brother-and-sister twin soldiers, during his inspection tours of military units, and with families of servicepersons and couples of discharged soldiers.
					
					 Those photos vividly show close relations between the leader and the people.

articles.title: First Camping Starts at Jangjasan Children's Camp
articles.content:
First Camping Starts at Jangjasan Children's Camp
						
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- This year's first camping started at the Jangjasan Children's Camp on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 A ceremony took place on Saturday to receive campers from Pyongyang, North and South Phyongan and Jagang provinces and other places of the country.
					
					 Director of the camp Chu Yong Nam made a report at the ceremony to be followed by speeches.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony campers had a march-past. Then followed an art performance given by teachers of the camp.
					
					 The first group of campers was congratulated by Ryu Yong Sop, chief secretary of the Jagang Provincial Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Tok Hun, chairman of the provincial people's committee, and officials concerned.

articles.title: Feats Performed by Kim Jong Il to Defend National Sovereignty
articles.content:
Feats Performed by Kim Jong Il to Defend National Sovereignty
						
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- On the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star (Feb. 16), the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il, the Korean people are recalling the feats he had performed to defend the destiny of the country and the nation in his lifetime.
					 By dint of the original Songun (military-first) politics, he protected the Korean-style socialism and turned the DPRK into a military giant and full-fledged nuclear weapons state.
					
					 Since its founding, the DPRK has been exposed to constant threats of aggression by the U.S.-led hostile forces.
					
					 The United States, after occupying south Korea, deployed more than 1 000 nuclear weapons in it, posing military threat to the DPRK. 
					
					 Taking advantage of the collapse of the former Soviet Union and the eastern European socialist countries, it began intensifying political, military and economic pressure upon the DPRK under the pretext of non-existent "nuclear suspicion".
					
					 The U.S. prodded the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) to making "ad-hoc inspection" of the DPRK, while resuming the "Team Spirit" joint military rehearsal and amassing its armed forces in and around the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 To cope with such touch-and-go situation prevailing on the Korean Peninsula, Kim Jong Il issued an order of the supreme commander of the Korean People's Army declaring a semi-war state to the whole country.
					
					 In the wake of it, he saw to it that a DPRK government statement was released to announce the DPRK's withdrawal from the Nuclear Non-proliferation Treaty (NPT).
					
					 Taking issue with the DPRK's nuclear facilities for peaceful purpose, the U.S. went the lengths of making public a scenario for preemptive nuclear attack on the DPRK.
					
					 The situation compelled the DPRK to get access to nuclear deterrent. It successfully conducted a nuclear test, turning itself to be a nuclear state.
					
					 Later, the U.S. created the second nuclear crisis on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 In this regard the DPRK manifested its firm will to maintain and bolster up its nuclear deterrence at the 1st Session of the 11th Supreme People's Assembly in September Juche 92 (2003).
					
					 In February 2005, the DPRK government in its foreign ministry statement declared that it would increase nuclear arsenal in order to defend its ideology, social system, freedom and democracy.
					
					 The dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un in his speech at a military parade celebrating the 100th Day of the Sun last year said that the military and technological superiority is no longer monopoly of the imperialists and gone never to return are the days when the enemies threatened and blackmailed the DPRK with nuclear weapons.
					
					 The DPRK's nuclear deterrent is a precious national treasure that can never be exchanged for anything, and the feats performed by Kim Jong Il to turn the country into a full-fledged nuclear state will remain long in the history of Korea.

articles.title: DPRK's Leading Newspapers Laud Exploits of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
DPRK's Leading Newspapers Laud Exploits of Kim Jong Il 
						
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- Leading newspapers of the DPRK Saturday dedicate editorials to the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The revolutionary life of Kim Jong Il for nearly seven decades was a life of the legendary great man who weathered the most stern trials in the modern history and brought about epoch-making victories and miracles, Rodong Sinmun says in its editorial, and goes on:
					
					 Kim Jong Il, who was born as the son of the people and grew up among them, established the noblest outlook on them and thoroughly embodied it in his ideological and theoretical activities and revolutionary leadership.
					
					 He found himself among the people in good or difficult days and devoted all his energies, enthusiasm and sincerity to them.
					
					 He provided important guidelines to be held fast to by the Workers' Party of Korea, the army and the people, ranging from the philosophical principle of the Juche idea to the Songun revolutionary line and the theory of building a thriving nation and from the building of the party, army and people's power to ideas and theories of making the whole world independent. His ideological and theoretical exploits were beyond human imagination.
					
					 It was thanks to his energetic leadership that the political and ideological unity of the whole society developed into the most solid and powerful single-minded unity and the Korean People's Army grew up to be a-match-for-a hundred revolutionary army and an army strong in ideology and faith possessed of the latest means for attack and defence.
					
					 The foundation of the self-supporting economy has grown remarkably stronger and there is a firm guarantee for building an economic power and highly civilized power thanks to the advance for great surge led by Kim Jong Il and the flames of the industrial revolution in the new century kindled by him.
					
					 He fully demonstrated the dignity of Songun Korea and firmly defended the global peace and stability with his superb diplomatic strategy and through his energetic external activities. This was the great feat performed by him for the human cause of independence.
					
					 The greatest exploit performed by him for the country and its people was that he successfully settled the issue of succession to the leadership.
					
					 Minju Joson in its editorial notes that his revolutionary life was the noble one of the gifted thinker and theoretician and peerless statesman who fully demonstrated the DPRK as a dignified political and ideological power.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Ridicules Confrontation Maniac's Hysteric Outbursts
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Ridicules Confrontation Maniacs' Hysteric Outbursts
						
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA)-- Lee Myung Bak, traitor for all ages, has gone mad with confrontation fervor as he is close to breathing his last as a politician.
					 He is free to let loose a spate of rigmaroles as the days go by, much upset by the DPRK's third nuclear test, its resolute step for self-defence taken to cope with the U.S. hostile action.
					
					 He held round-table talks of the advisory group on diplomacy and security and a meeting of aged citizens with riff-raffs on Friday at which he again cried out for "system change" in the north, talking about "fundamental interpretation of the nuclear issue in the north."
					
					 This is nothing but death-bed frenzy of the traitor destined to meet his end for his crimes. What he uttered only brought to light once again his inveterate disposition and bad habit which can never change before his dead.
					
					 It was none other than Lee who openly uttered that it was his "biggest dream and goal" to "achieve unification under liberal democracy" from the very day of his seizure of power and frantically stepped up the moves to "bring down the system" in the north and escalate confrontation with compatriots.
					
					 Just as he blustered in the first day of his office that "he was ready to keep the south-north relations frozen till its end," Lee totally negated the ideal common to the nation and its successes and has   systematically brought them to naught for the last several years.
					
					 He has chilled the nation's desire for reunification which had grown strong thanks to the adoption of the historic June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and savagely trampled down even a small sprout of reconciliation, unity and exchange. 
					
					 Moreover, he made no scruple of seriously doing harm to the dignity of the supreme leadership in the north and perpetrating such state-sponsored hideous terrorism.
					
					 The grave situation now prevailing on the Korean Peninsula is attributable to the hostile policy of the U.S. which does not like reconciliation, unity and reunification of the Korean nation and the vicious moves of the Lee group to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK as it is keen to prolong its remaining days.
					
					 The DPRK's nuclear test marked another crucial occasion that demonstrated once again before the whole world the politico-ideological might and military and technological capabilities of the heroic Korean people ready to put an end to all challenges of those who negate justice and truth.
					
					 Ridiculous, indeed, for rat-like Lee ignorant of how things are going in the world to vociferate about the long-bankrupt "system change", infected with dementia.
					
					 The fate of Lee as a politician is inching close to its end.
					
					 A Russian expert rightly commented: "When seizing power, Lee Myung Bak and his confidants were of the view that there came a historic opportunity to bring down the DPRK. But there is little time for them to do so. "
					
					  He will come to know before long how his fate tainted with crimes will come to an end.

articles.title: U.S., S. Korean Authorities Accused of Sparking Off Crisis
articles.content:
U.S., S. Korean Authorities Accused of Sparking Off Crisis
						
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- South Korean organizations released commentaries as regards the grave crisis created on the Korean Peninsula due to the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces' "sanctions" racket against the DPRK.
					 The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification in a commentary on Feb. 13 recalled that the U.S. and its allies cried out for the examination of "additional sanctions" against the DPRK over its third underground nuclear test.
					
					 The nuclear issue on the peninsula was spawned by the U.S. hostile policy including its threat of nuclear attack on the DPRK, the commentary held.
					
					 The U.S. has posed a threat of nuclear attack to the north since the Korean war and frequently violated the points agreed upon at the six-party talks, it noted. The U.S., in the long run, prodded the UN Security Council into cooking  up the "resolution on sanctions" against the DPRK over its  satellite launch, a sovereign state's right stipulated by international law, compelling the north to conduct the third nuclear test.
					
					 If the U.S. wants the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula, it should immediately roll back its hostile policy toward the DPRK, to begin with, the commentary noted.
					
					 The Solidarity for Progress in a commentary on Feb. 12 said that the "sanctions" racket kicked off by the U.S. and south Korea is inviting tougher counteraction of the north as it regards the racket as a declaration of war.
					
					 They should not increase the danger of war through such racket, the commentary held.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Slammed for Inciting Confrontation with Fellow Countrymen
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Slammed for Inciting Confrontation with Fellow Countrymen
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet group of traitors is kicking off a racket to intensify the anti-DPRK education among little schoolchildren.
					 On Feb. 13 the puppet Ministry of Education, Science and Technology sent primary, secondary and high schools across south Korea an official document calling for working out a "school program for education in security " which reflects the prevailing situation so that it may be included in the school educational program for the academic year of 2013.
					
					 It calls for strengthening the "education in security" for the purpose of inciting north-south confrontation at all schools from this year, and setting a week of "education in security" with June 25 as an occasion.
					
					 In order to increase the effect of such education, the puppet forces seek to show students anti-DPRK videos and spread their idea through a variety of social activities.
					
					 Meanwhile, the puppet Ministry of Defence in close touch with conservative teachers' organizations work hard to intensify study and training, putting main emphasis on letting teachers experience the present situation, and make city and provincial education agencies accept the method.
					
					 According to a teachers organization of south Korea, the regime has already worked hard to intensify the "education in security" among schoolchildren in a bid to malignantly slander the DPRK.
					
					 Responding to the call of the ultra-right group for shifting the blame for the crisis onto the north, taking issue with its recent nuclear test, the regime is putting "education in security" on a regular basis though it was conducted just one time in the past, and set to intensify it.
					
					 By doing so, the puppet group seeks to justify the belligerent nature of its policy for confrontation and evade the responsibility for the present catastrophic consequences.

articles.title: DPRK's Successful Underground Nuclear Test Hailed by Korean in U.S.
articles.content:
DPRK's Successful Underground Nuclear Test Hailed by Korean in U.S.
						
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- Ro Kil Nam, representative of Minjok Thongsin, an internet paper of Koreans in the U.S., on Feb. 13 issued an article hailing the DPRK's third underground nuclear test.
					 The successful nuclear test of the north reinforced the conviction and courage of many countries aspiring after independence, the article said.
					
					 The north has built socialism of Juche despite the moves of the U.S. imperialists to isolate and stifle it, holding fast to the line of being independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence, with the leader, party, army and people closely united as one, the article said.
					
					 The north has emerged a political, ideological, military power and space power which the U.S. imperialists dare not provoke, it noted.
					
					 The U.S. and other UNSC member nations insist that it is only they who are allowed to launch satellites and conduct nuclear tests, it said, and went on:
					
					 Any country in the world has the right to launch a satellite. Their assertion is contrary to reason and common sense.
					
					 Japan and south Korea, in particular, are behaving like dogs to meet the interests of the U.S. imperialists, after being Americanized. They keep mum about the fact that the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula was spawned by the U.S.
					
					 The DPRK's successful third underground nuclear test demonstrated the powerful might of self-defence to defend its sovereignty itself. It is, at the same time, a historic event in which it dealt a deadly blow at the U.S. imperialists and their followers wantonly violating the independent right of sovereign states.
					
					 It was the successful satellite launch and third underground nuclear test that helped the world know that the position and role of those countries aspiring after independent development have been remarkably enhanced and the DPRK is advancing at their head.

articles.title: U.S. Hostile Policy toward DPRK Assailed by Organizaton of Koreans in China
articles.content:
U.S. Hostile Policy toward DPRK Assailed by Organizaton of Koreans in China
						
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- The Secretariat of the General Association of Koreans in China on Feb. 13 released a statement titled "Brigandish U.S. imperialists' frantic hostile policy toward DPRK is bound to meet doom".
					 All the Koreans in China fully support the DPRK's successful third underground nuclear test, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 The DPRK's nuclear test was a resolute step for self-defence to cope with the U.S. hostile action against it.
					
					 But the U.S. and its allies prodded the UN Security Council, a marionette, into fabricating a new "resolution on sanctions," terming the DPRK's satellite launch an act of violating the UNSC's "resolution".
					
					 Encroaching upon the right to satellite launch is an unpardonable grave hostile act as it is a violation of the DPRK's sovereignty.
					
					 60 years have passed since the UN emerged and there have been more than 2 000 nuclear tests and at least 9 000 satellite launches on the earth during the period. But there has never been a UNSC's resolution banning nuclear test or satellite launch.
					
					 The U.S. which conducted more nuclear tests and launched more satellites than any others cooked up the UNSC's "resolution" banning only the DPRK's nuclear test and satellite launch. This is a breach of international law, the height of double standards and rash action.
					
					 The inspection of vessels, sea blockade and the like touted by the hostile forces will amount to a declaration of war and spark off merciless retaliatory strikes at their strongholds.
					
					 All the service personnel and people of the DPRK advancing under the outstanding leadership of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un will wipe out with bullets and bombs of Songun the U.S. and Japanese imperialists, the sworn enemy, and the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors, their lackeys, and achieve the national reunification, the greatest desire of the Korean nation, without fail.

articles.title: Bulletin Issued by International United Confederation of Koreans
articles.content:
Bulletin Issued by International United Confederation of Koreans
						
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- The International United Confederation of Koreans released the January issue, Juche 102 (2013) of its bulletin Thongil.
					 The bulletin carried the full text of the New Year Address of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un illustrated with a photo of him making the address.
					
					 It edited the full text of the speech made by him at the banquet given for the scientists, technicians, workers and officials who contributed to successful launch of satellite Kwangmyongsong 3-2 and introduced in detail the account of the banquet.
					
					 Also conveyed by it was the news that the title of the DPRK hero was awarded to the contributors to the satellite launch.
					
					 It gave an account of the opening of the Fourth Conference of Cell Secretaries of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 It carried a memorandum issued by the DPRK Foreign Ministry calling for dismantling the "UN Command" in south Korea in order to defend the peace and security in the Korean Peninsula and the Asia-Pacific region.
					
					 It also carried statements of the DPRK National Defence Commission and its Foreign Ministry rejecting the UN Security Council's "resolution on sanctions" against the DPRK over its satellite launch for peaceful purposes.
					
					 It also conveyed news from the homeland and world news.

articles.title: Chongryon Central Standing Committee Denounces Japanese Authorities' Dastardly Action
articles.content:
Chongryon Central Standing Committee Denounces Japanese Authorities' Dastardly Action
						
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- The Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) released a statement on Thursday denouncing the Japanese conservative authorities for their base suppression of Chongryon.
					 The statement accused Japanese Prime Minister Abe of asserting in a "statement" issued on February 12 in connection with the 3rd underground nuclear test of the DPRK that "Japan does not recognize the reentry of the vice-chairmen of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon into Japan for taking passage" for the DPRK" as part of "additional sanctions" against it. 
					
					 The statement noted that the independent "sanctions" enforced by Japan up to this date against the DPRK since the Abe regime in 2006 included such unpardonable actions: A ban on the entry of all ships from the DPRK, a total ban on export and import with it, a ban on the entry of the persons with the DPRK's nationality and reentry of deputies to the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly including the chairman of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon and a total ban on the exchange of goods, taking  out  of money and financial transaction. 
					
					 The statement vehemently slammed Abe for taking such unjust additional measures as disallowing the reentry of the vice-chairmen of Chongryon as part of the steps for stepping up the hostile policy towards the DPRK.
					
					 This measure is a dastardly suppression of even Chongryon, an organization for protecting the life and rights of the compatriots in Japan, and an extremely harsh human rights abuse, it said, and went on:
					
					 Over the past 58 years since its formation, Chongryon has played the role of a bridge linking the two countries to promote the bilateral friendship by directing efforts to the work for preserving the national character of the Koreans in Japan, protecting their life and human rights and realizing mutual help among them and their welfare on the principle of non-interference in the internal affairs and observance of law in Japan. 
					
					 The vice-chairmen of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon have creditably fulfilled their responsibilities in various fields such as activities to serve the compatriots.
					
					 The Japanese government's view that the Chongryon officials elected by Koreans in Japan are "in the position to substantially assist the authorities of north Korea in their activities as staff members" is totally contrary to the fact. It is nothing but a pretext for cracking down upon Chongryon as it is sophism misleading the public opinion.
					
					 Chongryon and all Koreans in Japan vehemently denounce the Japanese government for its unjust and high-handed action and strongly protest against it.
					
					 Intolerable is the behavior of Japan threatening the life of the Koreans in Japan and restricting the fair activities of Chongryon, a legitimate national organization of the compatriots in Japan, far from settling its past crimes and making reparation to the Koreans who were victims of Japan's colonial rule and forcibly taken away to Japan and their descendants.
					
					 Such additional "sanctions" will not only spark off denunciation and resistance of all Koreans in Japan and fair-minded Japanese people but seriously affect the efforts to improve the relations between the DPRK and Japan.
					
					 We strongly demand the Japanese government immediately lift its "sanctions" against the vice-chairmen of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon and drop all other unreasonable "sanctions" and, at the same time, ensure the human rights and life of the Koreans in Japan.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Germany
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Germany
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "The Songun-based Revolutionary Line Is a Great Revolutionary Line of Our Era and an Ever-Victorious Banner of Our Revolution" was brought out in booklet by a publishing house in Germany on Feb. 8.
					 The work, made public on January 29, Juche 92 (2003), expounds the idea that the Songun revolutionary line and Songun politics pursued by the Workers' Party of Korea are the powerful political mode which inherited President Kim Il Sung's idea and line of giving priority to the army, and the scientific revolutionary line and political mode which most correctly reflect the demands of the era and revolution.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in France
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in France
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Brilliantly Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche, Holding Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as the Eternal General Secretary of Our Party" was published in booklet by the Democrate Publishing House of France on February 10.
					 The work, published on April 6, Juche 101 (2012), clarifies that it is the principled demand for victoriously advancing the Korean revolutionary cause to hold leader Kim Jong Il in high esteem as eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea. It also indicates the tasks for steadily strengthening and developing the WPK into the glorious party of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised as Outstanding Statesman by Bangladeshi Figure
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised as Outstanding Statesman by Bangladeshi Figure
						
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- Garib Newaz, president of the Bangladesh People's League, lauded leader Kim Jong Il as an outstanding statesman who steered to victory the Korean revolution with his brilliant ideological and theoretical activities and extraordinary leadership. He said this when meeting with the charge d'affaires ad interim of the DPRK embassy there on Feb. 8.
					 The undying exploits Kim Jong Il performed for the Korean revolution and the cause of global independence would be always remembered by mankind, Garib Newaz noted, adding:
					
					 I am sure that the Workers' Party of Korea, army and people will certainly carry forward and accomplish the revolutionary cause of Songun and the cause of building a thriving country under the leadership of His Excellency Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The U.S. unreasonable denial of the DPRK's right to satellite launch is the most vivid manifestation of the hostile policy and open provocation to the DPRK as it is the height of double standards and shameless behavior. 
					
					 I condemn the U.S. hostile policy for disturbing space science and technology and economic development in the DPRK in violation of the fundamental principles of the UN Charter which calls for respecting the sovereignty of each country and ensuring impartiality and even the universally accepted international law.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised in India
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised in India
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- An Indian national seminar was held in New Delhi on February 9 to mark the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 On display in its venue were his works, and publications introducing the DPRK.
					
					  The secretary of the National Council of the Communist Party of India, the secretary general of the International Kim Il Sung Prize Council and the International Kim Jong Il Prize Council who doubles as director general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, the chairman of the Indian Society for the Study of Works of Kim Jong Il and other figures made speeches.
					
					 The speakers prayed for Kim Jong Il's immortality, saying that the DPRK turned into a powerful country thanks to February 16 when he was born.
					
					 They praised him as a peerless statesman, iron-willed brilliant commander possessed of matchless pluck, tender-hearted father of the people and guardian of socialism.
					
					 They went on:
					
					 He firmly defended the dignity and sovereignty of the country and nation with the Juche idea and Songun idea and laid a strong foundation for building a thriving nation.
					
					 He made the DPRK emerge in the international arena a nuclear weapons state, satellite manufacturer and launcher, frustrating the moves of the imperialists against socialism.
					
					 His revolutionary cause of Songun is being successfully carried forward by the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the seminar.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Revolutionary Life Lauded by Mexican Political Party Leader
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Revolutionary Life Lauded by Mexican Political Party Leader
						
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- Jesus Antonio Carlos Hernandez, general secretary of the Central Committee of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico, issued a statement on Feb. 6 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star).
					 Kim Jong Il devoted all his life to the country and its people, the general secretary said, and went on:
					
					 Cherishing warm love for the people, he honorably protected the dignity and sovereignty of the nation from all challenges of the imperialist allied forces.
					
					 Holding aloft the banner of the Juche idea, he pursued the great Songun politics, protecting the national sovereignty and socialism and wisely leading the cause of national reunification.
					
					 As a result, the historic north-south summit was held in June, 2000 and this resulted in the adoption of the June 15 joint declaration, a milestone for Korea's reunification, and the publication of the October 4 declaration, a programme for implementing it, in 2007.
					
					 Indeed, his life was a brilliant one totally dedicated to the country and its people.
					
					 The Korean people are greatly fortunate to have the dear respected Kim Jong Un identical to him at the top posts of the party, state and army.
					
					  We express belief that the Korean people would make bigger successes in their general advance for building a thriving socialist nation and achieving the country's reunification under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star Marked Abroad
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- Events took place in various countries to mark the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star).
					 They included meetings, round-table talks, book and photo exhibitions and film shows in Hong Kong, China, Romania, Cambodia, Singapore, Mongolia and Ethiopia between Feb. 1 and 7.
					
					 On display in the venues of the events were photos on revolutionary activities of Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Their works, books and photos introducing Songun Korea were also on display.
					
					 Korean films shown included "Arms of Korea".
					
					 The vice president of the Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il Fund in a speech lauded Kim Jong Il as a great man who made great contributions to the cause of building a thriving socialist nation in the DPRK and the cause of global independence.
					
					 The chairman of the Supreme Council of the Socialist Party of Romania said thanks to the energetic ideological and theoretical activities and wise leadership of Kim Jong Il the DPRK is shedding its rays as a beacon of hope for the world progressives.
					
					 The Korean people are dynamically stepping up the building of a thriving socialist nation under the leadership of HE Kim Jong Un, faithful successor to the idea and cause of the preceding leaders, he noted.
					
					 The manager of the Ram Seng Hang Private Co. Ltd. of Singapore said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il was a prominent leader and a peerless statesman. I am sure that his ideal and desire will surely come true under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The chairperson of the Addis Ababa Youth Association of Ethiopia praised Kim Jong Il for consolidating the single-minded unity of the whole society in the DPRK as firm as a rock and putting its military capability on the highest level under the banner of Songun. 
					
					 A message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the event held in Mongolia.

articles.title: Malaysia-DPRK Friendship Association Inaugurated
articles.content:
Malaysia-DPRK Friendship Association Inaugurated
						
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- The Malaysia-DPRK Friendship Association was inaugurated with due ceremony on February 6.
					 At the ceremony the chairman of the association said it would make a positive contribution to boosting the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Malaysia and promoting the understanding between the two peoples and strengthening the bilateral exchange and ties in the fields of culture and economy.

articles.title: Former Peruvian Legislators Reject UNSC's "Resolution" against DPRK
articles.content:
Former Peruvian Legislators Reject UNSC's "Resolution" against DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- Rolando Brena Pantoja, Tani Baler Lopera and Oscar Felipe Bentura and other former Peruvian legislators on January 31 sent a joint letter to the UN Security Council protesting against its unjust anti-DPRK "resolution".
					 The letter said:
					
					 We express indignation at the UNSC which fabricated a "resolution" against the DPRK over its launch of satellite Kwangmyongsong 3-2 in accordance to its program for space development for peaceful purposes.
					
					 The government and people of the DPRK have the right to conduct scientific research for its peaceful progress and development. They have the universally recognized right to use space for peaceful purposes. 
					
					 The U.S. prodded the UNSC into cooking up a "resolution" against the DPRK out of its enmity towards the latter. 
					
					 Regretful is the fact that member states of the UNSC joined in fabricating such "resolution" threatening the DPRK.
					
					 We reject the "resolution" of the UNSC which takes issue with the DPRK's satellite launch for peaceful purposes.
					
					 The UNSC should respect the sovereignty of the DPRK.

articles.title: DPRK's "Missile Threat", No More Than Excuse: Russian Expert
articles.content:
DPRK's "Missile Threat", No More Than Excuse: Russian Expert 
						
 Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- According to the Voice of Russia, an expert of Russia said that the "missile threat" from the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, touted by some forces, is no more than an excuse and the missile crisis in Asia is ascribable to the United States,.
					 The south Korean defence minister's recent call for beefing up missile potential is what was expected, as it was a result of the confab between the U.S. and south Korea, Alexandr Vorontsov, a researcher at the Institute of Oriental Studies of the Russian Academy of Sciences, added.
					
					 The researcher further said:
					
					 In October last year, the U.S. gave a green light to south Korea's proposal on extending the range of missile up to 800 kilometers. The approval evoked different responses from the international community.  
					
					  The Foreign Ministry of Russia expressed apprehension over it. It was because such move would spark off a new round of arms race, missile race in the Korean Peninsula. Now the south Korean authorities claim that the measure was taken to cope with the nuclear test conducted by the DPRK.
					
					 The escalated missile crisis in Asia is due to the U.S behavior.
					
					The agreement signed between south Korea and the U.S. in the past suggested that the former can get access to missiles with a range of less than 300 kilometers.
					
					 At present the U.S. allowed south Korea to extend it up to 800 kilometers.
					
					 Besides, it schemes to offer south Korea the information obtained from satellites and drones, should south Korea set up an integrated MD system, which is a part of the theatre missile defence system sought by the U.S.
					
					 The DPRK's "missile threat" is no more than an excuse.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un rinde homenaje a Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un rinde homenaje a Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il 
						
Pyongyang, 16 de febrero (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, visito el dia 16 con su esposa Ri Sol Ju el Palacio del Sol Kumsusan para rendir sublime homenaje al Generalisimo Kim Jong Il con motivo del Dia de la Estrella Luz (dia de natalicio del Generalisimo).
					El Mariscal entro en el hall donde se encuentran las estatuas de pie de los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il. 
					
					El jefe de la Guardia de Honor de las fuerzas terrestres, navales, aereas y antiaereas y de la guardia roja obrero-campesina dirigio el parte de recepcion a los Generalisimos.
					
					Fue colocado un cesto de flores en nombre del Mariscal Kim Jong Un al pie de las estatuas de pie.
					
					El Mariscal, junto con los acompanantes, expreso homenaje postumo a los Generalisimos y entro seguidamente en el hall donde se conserva el cuerpo de Kim Jong Il.
					
					Ahi volvio a rendirle sublime homenaje con los acompanantes.
					
					Luego, paso revista a las salas de conservacion de las ordenes, auto, carro electrico, barco y tren, usados por el Dirigente.
					
					Le acompanaron en esta ocasion Choe Ryong Hae, Jang Song Thaek, Hyon Yong Chol, Kim Kyok Sik, Kim Kyong Hui, Pak To Chun, Kim Yong Chun, Hyon Chol Hae, Kim Won Hong, Kim Jong Gak, Ju Kyu Chang, Kim Kyong Ok, Yun Jong Rin, Choe Pu Il, Ri Yong Gil, Son Chol Ju, Ryom Chol Song, Jo Kyong Chol, Yun Tong Hyon, Kang Phyo Yong, Ri Pyong Chol, Kim Rak Gyom, Pak Jong Chon, Kim Chun Sam, Kim Yong Chol, Jon Chang Bok y otros miembros de la Comision Militar Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y del Comite de Defensa Nacional, los miembros del mando operacional de la Comandancia Suprema del EPC y los comandantes del EPC.

articles.title: Cuadros del partido y Estado rinden homenaje a Kim Jong Il

articles.title: Erguidas estatuas de bronce de Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il en Escuela de Mangyondae
articles.content:
Erguidas estatuas de bronce de Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il en Escuela de Mangyondae
Pyongyang, 16 de febrero (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 16 en la Escuela Revolucionaria de Mangyongdae la solemne ceremonia de descubrimiento de las estatuas de bronce de los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il  erguidas con motivo del Dia de la Estrella Luz.
					Asistio a la ocasion el Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					
					Tambien estuvieron presentes Choe Yong Rim, Choe Ryong Hae, Jang Song Thaek, Hyon Yong Chol, Kim Kyok Sik, Kim Kyong Hui, Kim Ki Nam, Kim Yong Chun, Ri Yong Mu, O Kuk Ryol, Hyon Chol Hae, Kim Jong Gak y otros funcionarios de las instituciones del partido y las fuerzas armadas, los profesores, empleados, alumnos y graduados de la escuela, los funcionarios de las unidades y academias militares a todos niveles, los oficiales y soldados del EPC, las familias de los militares, los funcionarios y empleados de las unidades que contribuyeron a levantarlas y trabajadores capitalinos.
					
					Las estatuas de bronce fueron descubiertas por Choe Yong Rim, Choe Ryong Hae, Jang Song Thaek, etc.
					
					Fue depositado un cesto de flores en nombre del Mariscal.
					
					Ademas, fueron colocados un cesto de flores en nombre comun del CC del PTC, la Comision Militar Central del PTC y el CDN de la RPDC y el otro a nombre de la Escuela Revolucionaria de Mangyongdae.
					
					Tambien, fueron puestos los cestos de flores en nombre de la Direccion Politica General del EPC, el Estado Mayor General del EPC, el Ministerio de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, las unidades y subunidades del EPC y las academias militares.
					
					Todos los participantes rindieron tributo postumo  a los Generalisimos.
					
					El discurso de la ocasion estuvo a cargo del vicemariscal del EPC Choe Ryong Hae, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del CC del PTC y jefe de la Direccion Politico General del EPC.
					
					El orador dijo que desde los primeros dias de la direccion revolucionaria, el Generalisimo Kim Jong Il considero la educacion sobre los hijos de los martires como la labor muy importante para continuar la arteria de la revolucion coreana y presto profunda atencion a la labor de la citada escuela aun en el arduo periodo en que con la bandera del Songun, conducia a la victoria el enfrentamiento antiyanqui y el combate por la defensa del socialismo.
					
					Senalo que constituye el unanime deseo de todos los profesores, empleados y alumnos de la escuela, los oficiales y soldados del EPC levantar la estatua de bronce del Dirigente Kim Jong Il en dicho plantel docente donde fue erguido por primera vez en Corea la estatua de bronce del Presidente Kim Il Sung por iniciativa de la Heroina de la Lucha Antijaponesa Kim Jong Suk quien se enteraba de ardiente deseo de esos huerfanos de ver de dia en dia al Lider padre.
					
					Refirio que este deseo se ha hecho realidad por la sublime fidelidad del Mariscal Kim Jong Un y su minuciosa direccion.
					
					Es mas radiante el futuro de los hijos de los martires revolucionarios, dijo y exhorto a todos a esforzarse por reunificar la patria y llevar a feliz termino la causa revolucionaria del Songun siguiendo a la direccion del Mariscal, bandera de la eterna victoria de la potencia del monte Paektu, como descendientes y discipulos de los generalisimos.
					
					El Mariscal respondio cordialmente a las fervorosas aclamaciones de todos los participantes en el acto.

articles.title: Se ofrece banquete por dia de natalicio de Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Se ofrece banquete por dia de natalicio de Kim Jong Il
						
Pyongyang, 16 de febrero (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar este dia en el Restaurante Okryu la recepcion por el 71o aniversario de natalicio del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					Estuvieron presentes en la ocasion Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim y otros cuadros directivos del partido y el Estado, los presidentes de los partidos amigos, los funcionarios de las instituciones del partido, las fuerzas armadas y el Poder, el Consejo de Ministerios, las entidades de masas, los ministerios y organos centrales, los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea y del Ejercito de Seguridad Interior del Pueblo de Corea, los funcionarios y hombres ameritados de las ramas de ciencia, educacion, literatura y arte, salud publica, prensa e informacion.
					
					Ademas se distinguian las delegaciones de los compatriotas radicados en ultramar, incluyendo la de los coreanos residentes en Japon, y los coreanos en ultramar y el representante de la sucursal del Frente Democratico Nacional Antiimperialista en Pyongyang.
					
					Fueron invitados los matrimonios de los representantes diplomaticos de varios paises, los representantes de las organizaciones internacionales y los agregados militares, acreditados en Corea, y los huespedes extranjeros.
					
					El discurso de la ocasion estuvo a cargo de Kim Ki Nam, miembro del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					
					El dijo que el Dirigente acumulo imperecederas hazanas ante la patria, el pueblo, la epoca y la historia al dirigir durante largo tiempo por la senda victoriosa la revolucion coreana y la causa de independencia de la humanidad.
					
					Senalo que todos, enalteciendo al Dirigente como eterno lider del PTC y la revolucion, deben marchar recto hasta el final por el camino de la independencia, el Songun y el socialismo bajo la bandera del inmortal kimilsungismo-kimjongilismo.
					
					Llamo a fortalecer por todos los medios el poderio combativo del partido en acato al mensaje del Ano Nuevo pronunciado por el Mariscal Kim Jong Un y a su discurso hecho en la 4a conferencia de los secretarios de celula del PTC y a registrar cambio decisivo en la lucha por lograr la victoria final en la construccion de un Estado prospero.
